info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 8 at 8:05PM CDT until May 9 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS New Orleans LA
info.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Mississippi...
East Hobolochitto Creek Near Caesar affecting Pearl River County.
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Mississippi...
West Hobolochitto Creek Near McNeil affecting Pearl River County.
For the West Hobolochitto Creek...including McNeil...Minor flooding is forecast. For the East Hobolochitto Creek...including Caesar...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...West Hobolochitto Creek near McNeil.
* WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon.
* IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Some secondary roads near the stream north of Picayune will be inundated. Beech Street and Westchester Subdivision below the confluence of the east and west branches will be subject to flooding in low places.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 PM CDT Thursday the stage was 16.0 feet. - Bankfull stage is 10.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage tomorrow morning and continue falling to 6.9 feet Tuesday evening. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lix. Click on the Rivers and Lakes menu for forecasts and observations.
The next statement will be issued Friday afternoon at 1215 PM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON
